question.title: Apache Flink Resolving Table
question.body:
Trying my Flink Table API app to drain Kafka events into a Iceberg Table:

I am trying to create DB resources using pure Flink Java API https://gist.github.com/kameshsampath/0c4ad07b236bd38e999316598141b93e#file-vehicletelemetryprocessor-java-L167, when I try to create the table it throws me the following error:

21:31:41,939 ERROR dev.kameshs.demos.flink.iceberg                              [] - Error running job
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: table should be resolved
    at [org.apache.iceberg.relocated.com](http://org.apache.iceberg.relocated.com).google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument(Preconditions.java:143) ~[iceberg-flink-runtime-1.20-1.7.1.jar:?]
    at org.apache.iceberg.flink.FlinkCatalog.createTable(FlinkCatalog.java:394) ~[iceberg-flink-runtime-1.20-1.7.1.jar:?]
    at dev.kameshs.demos.flink.iceberg.VehicleTelemetryProcessor.lambda$main$0(VehicleTelemetryProcessor.java:167) ~[main/:?]
    at java.util.Optional.ifPresent(Optional.java:178) ~[?:?]
    at dev.kameshs.demos.flink.iceberg.VehicleTelemetryProcessor.main(VehicleTelemetryProcessor.java:106) [main/:?]

Any clue/pointer/example how to fix this?

Thank you.
